profile.ja:
1940 （昭和15年 紀元2600年） 広島県福山市に生れる。
1942-45 台湾・基隆市にて終戦を迎える。
1958 広島大学 附属福山高等学校 卒業
1962 大阪大学 工学部 電気工学科 卒業
1964 大阪大学大学院 工学研究科 原子力工学専攻 修士課程修了
1964 博士課程に入学するも12月末に中退
職歴・研究歴：
1965 大阪大学 基礎工学部 制御工学科 助手
1966-67 フランス政府給費留学生としてサクレー原子力研究所 客員研究員
1969 大阪大学 基礎工学部 制御工学科 助教授
1979-80 南カリフォルニア大学画像処理研究所客員研究員
1985 大阪大学 基礎工学部 制御工学科 教授
1997 大阪大学大学院 基礎工学研究科システム人間系 システム科学分野 教授
2003 大阪大学 名誉教授
広島国際大学 人間環境学部 感性情報学科 教授
2005 宝塚大学 メディア・コンテンツ学部 教授

paper_title.en: Non-verbal mapping between sound and color - Mapping derived from colored hearing synesthetes and its applications

description.en: This paper presents an attempt at 'non-verbal mapping' between music and images. We use physical parameters of key, height and timbre as sound, and hue, brightness and chroma as color, to clarify their direct correspondence. First we derive a mapping rule between sound and color from those with such special abilities as 'colored hearing'. Next we apply the mapping to everyday people using a paired comparison test and key identification training, and we find similar phenomena to colored hearing among everyday people. The experimental result shows a possibility that they also have potential of ability of sound and color mapping.

paper_title.ja: ThermoPainter:熱画像を用いたタブレット型入力装置とそのインタラクティブ描画システム
A Basic Study on Teammates’ Mental Workload among Ship’s Bridge Team
paper_title.en: A basic study on teammates' mental workload among ship's bridge team

description.en: Ship handling for leaving and entering port always carries out for a captain. deck officers and quartermasters and sometimes include a pilot. For navigational watch keeping at sea except for a narrow channel and under restricted visibility etc.. the deck officer and quartermaster do it. They achieve safe and efficient navigational watch keeping with their teamwork at a ship's bridge. The importance of teamwork has been recognized in the shipping world, and its training and education methods are also thought over. However. their evaluation is not clear, because they are depended on the experience of the trainers. Therefore, we need to make an evaluation method of teamwork for education and training of the ship handling. In this paper, we define that ship's bridge teamwork is shown by 1) a change of mental workload level and 2) a change of mental workload for time. we challenge to evaluate teammates mental workload in the ship's bridge with R-R interval of subjects' heart rate variability, and we evaluate their mental workloads with the following three steps. 1) To confirm the evaluation of the mental workload of a ship's navigator with R-R interval. 2) To evaluate teamwork with R-R interval in case of an oral presentation at meetings as pre-experiments. 3) To evaluate the teammates' mental workload among ship's bridge team in case of a leaving port. Their results showed that the method using R-R interval was sufficient for the evaluation of teamwork effects.

publication_name.ja: IEICE Transactions on Information and Systems
publication_name.en: IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON INFORMATION AND SYSTEMS

paper_title.en: The effects of the timing of commercial breaks on the loss of attention

description.en: Commercial breaks are often placed at the climax of stories in recent TV programs in Japan, which may cause some serious effects on audiences, especially children, since this practice disturbs the concentrations. The experiment measured the psycho-physiological state of four children before and after commercials. The results showed that the next peak of attention is delayed by distracting the attention.

publication_name.en: IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON INFORMATION AND SYSTEMS

paper_title.en: The mental workload of a ship's navigator using heart rate variability

description.en: A human navigator attempts to handle the ship for safe navigation by judging navigational information on own ship's condition, targets and current-wind effects. He/she has the responsibility of human lives and the economic values to judge. The human navigator maintains high mental workload during the navigational watch keeping. Therefore, we need to develop a support system to reduce the mental workload with human-system cooperation based on the navigator's KANSEI, and we must research an index to assess the mental workload for the first step, as the research on the KANSEI of ship's navigator is not yet available in the world. In addition we depend on the professional's experience for the assessment. The purpose of this paper is to find characteristics of the mental workload using heart rate variability. The experiment is carried out in six types of sea area on the west side of Japan. The subject is the chief officer of a training ship at Kobe University. © 2004, Emerald Group Publishing Limited

paper_title.en: The mental workload of a ship's navigator using heart rate variability

description.en: A human navigator attempts to handle the ship for safe navigation by judging navigational information on own ship's condition, targets and current-wind effects. He/she has the responsibility of human lives and the economic values to judge. The human navigator maintains high mental workload during the navigational watch keeping. Therefore, we need to develop a support system to reduce the mental workload with human-system cooperation based on the navigator's KANSEI, and we must research an index to assess the mental workload for the first step, as the research on the KANSEI of ship's navigator is not yet available in the world. In addition we depend on the professional's experience for the assessment. The purpose of this paper is to find characteristics of the mental workload using heart rate variability. The experiment is carried out in six types of sea area on the west side of Japan. The subject is the chief officer of a training ship at Kobe University. © 2004, Emerald Group Publishing Limited
